word:
We must get away from our smallness, and make larger plans. There must be a wider reaching forth to work for those who are nigh, and those who are afar off. . . .Let there be special efforts made for the enlightenment of the Jews. Every soul converted causes joy in the heavenly courts. Ms 87, 1907, p. 8. ("Our Duty toward the Jews," August 16, 1907.) 

White Estate Washington, D.C.
